title: Why do people act like they can't do anything during the 22 whole seconds Zed doesn't have his W?
body:
Just curious. 

Why can't people actually abuse Zed during that huge 22 second window where Zed is nothing but a melee Q bot after using his shadow?

People behave as if Zed has super huge mobility in laning when realistically it's significantly more gated than almost any other dash early game. I'm confused.

replies.body:
You say its significantly more gated. I disagree. Lets think about other midlaners with mobility pre-6:

{{champion:7}} W is only form of waveclear and a large part of her damage. 
{{champion:268}} Needs to be in melee range for the shield/damage. 
{{champion:245}} Usually the only reliable way to proc a stun and/or get the 3-hit proc
{{champion:157}} Needs a minion or enemy champion
{{champion:91}} Only offensive

Zed's mobility is different because its more versatile. It can be used to poke, but he has other forms of poke without it. It can be used to waveclear, but he has other forms of waveclear without it. It can be used offensively and defensively. 

Zed can still waveclear and poke without his W. Other mobile champions like Leblanc cant.

"Needs a minion or enemy champion"

Good thing there aren't any of those in the lane.

It means that he can't use it to just dash around everywhere he wants whenever he wants. He's super powerful in the enemy wave, but if he's near his own minions and not the enemies', he has no mobility whatsoever
Katarina and Akali...
Katarina needs a target, and Akali needs an enemy.
I know. I was just pointing out two mid laners you people forgot. And I got downvoted for it. Rip.

I think youre missing the point of this thread and the point of my post. It specifically talks about GATED MOBILITY. 

1. Zed and Leblanc are both pretty proficient at killing you. Zed can also kill you and farm after. Or he can farm while killing you. Or he can just farm. I said that Zed's mobility is more versatile - and youre response completely ignores that. 

2. Again, talking about versatility. You dont know how Azir's W works, do you? You dont realize that engaging with it pre-6 is generally not the greatest idea? So its versatility is lower, right? 

3. Is his mobility less gated than Zeds? Youre response isnt really responding to my post. 

4. Because sometimes, just sometimes, you want to use mobility defensively. Sometimes jumping on the enemy champion ISNT what you want to do. And during those situations, ground targeted mobility spells are a lot more useful. Again, we are talking about gated mobility. 

5. Lower single target damage. Lower range. Uses mana. And still less mobile.

Because he clears the wave, probably gets off a lot of poke, then sits back and Q farms. If you want to go in for a trade there is a high chance you will have to go very close to him to get it done, pre 6 this is n't an issue but post 6 he can just ult you and use his ult shadow to kill you.

these are two different situations. One where he plays safe and Q farms and one where he punishes you for trying to poke him back

So he clears your minions using W, then pokes you from behind his minions.

At early levels this means you can't harass him back unless you want to tank his minion wave, at later levels he can all in you if you decide you want to punish him. It's not rocket science, if you give a champion a way to clear the wave no one wants to face-tank a bunch of minions just to get a little poke in.
Bullshit, you can't clear an entire wave, in laning phase, yall spouting BS. At most that will kill one minon and the rest will be at 70%.

Just off of base damages alone (Not including the scaling 130-180% of bonus AD) he deals anywhere from 40-60% to everything in the wave from level 3 on. That's with 0 AD built. Considering with runes and a longsword you deal an extra 50% damage ontop of those bases, you're rolling 60-80% at level 3 on.

Because most peoples first instinct when taking damage is to retreat, letting the enemy abuse them for free. This is why champs like Zed and Yasuo completely dominate bad players early game, especially Yasuo.

The problem is the range on his harass is pretty long, so the most you can do is zone him from minions to some extent. 

Even then, he can play pretty passively by last-hitting with Q, meanwhile you're probably standing in a somewhat pushed-up position as an immobile mage. Even if the jungler doesn't come and kill you, you're still gated by mana while he isn't.

If Zed is passively farming with Q's, you should be zoning the fuck out of him. He's used his main combat spell to farm, leaving him with absolutely nothing to hit you with. If the enemy laner is using their main skill to farm, you should be being super aggressive.

I think the general problem that occurs after that is it leaves you open as a free gank (unless it's frozen of course) or if zed manages to land a few Q's or a weq combo while you're zoning him he instantly gets control of the lane back.
Not really as black and white as "just zone him."

Um... what other early dashes are you talking about in terms of mids? 
Leblanc? 18 seconds, costs mana, no refund. Similar level of mobility.
Ekko? 325 range(less than half of zed's shadow's range), less versatile, costs mana, no refund.
Corki? 26 second CD. Costs mana. Lower Range. No refund. 

You act like a CD is gating the moves ability to get him OUT of a fight, when in reality Zed basically never uses the shadow in lane to get away, he uses it to deal ludicrous damage, refund energy, and then either all in or go back to safely farming with q's.  You can't go in and harass him after he uses it because if he uses it correctly, you get chunked HARD, and your liable to get "outplayed" by him switching to his shadow, procing his passive, then igniting you. Unless you pick a SUPER long range mage.
Even if he just uses it to poke you, he can do it from ~1600 range. For reference that's ~ a Caitlyn ult + an Ekko dashes worth of distance.

His laning phase is safe because he never actually needs to go in or get close until he wants to. Unlike talon who has mana+long CD's+ short range+ and basically HAS to 100-0 his target or he'll just jump in and die instantly.
if you get hit by a shadowed zed Q at max range, you deserve it.

So you're left with either losing Lane or a generic farm lane. Never a chance to abuse a lead.

Well for one, early game he doesn't even really need his shadow that often. He just Q's to farm since he doesn't have to worry about mana. Second, pretty much every item now has CDR, so the CD is never 22 seconds anyway. And by the time it would get important, he has a rank or two in it anyway. 

It's the classic thing Riot does with it's "golden boy" champions, they "nerf" an ability on the champ and then either buff another of their abilities, improve their itemization, or buff their mastery to compensate. So the Riot favorite champions are never really nerfed at all.

Let's assume Zed builds 40% Cooldown Reduction.

22 seconds > 13.2 seconds

Let's also say he grabs the 5% Cooldown Reduction mastery instead of the flat penetration for some reason.

22 seconds > 12.1 seconds

That's still a big window for people to toss in a few abilities and auto-attacks while Zed no form of escape.

You are forgetting that is only the rank 1 CD. At max rank it's only 8 seconds with max CDR. That's a fairly small window by itself but then you have to factor in that if you try to all in him while it's on CD, he can still ult you.

That's why you don't all-in him, that's his job, and unless you're also an assassin or a burst mage, he's likely to do it faster than you can.

Turns out, one of Zed's biggest weaknesses is how he's also extremely squishy, and that makes him pretty vulnerable to poke harassment. Another big weakness is he has to play safely until "the right moment" appears, one of the same weaknesses a lot of burst mages and other assassins have. 

It also turns out many assassins and burst mages are actually really weak to taking constant poke damage.

Also, if Zed decides he wants to ult you, turn around. As in, he literally reappears directly behind your champion, so if you have some sort of stun/root/knockback/slow/anything to prevent him from moving or dealing damage to you, use it directly behind your champion the moment he appears. Especially if he decides to turret dive you. That's a really easy way to kill him with little effort.

Zed is definitely not invincible, his playstyle is "stay safe, poke, and wait for a moment to ult>unleash combo". As long as you play safely, and deny him the potential of dealing any meaningful ult damage (it's not the ult so much as all the other damage he deals while the ult is activating), he's not gonna be able to do much of anything to you.

Also, does Zed ever max his W first, or even second? While it would give him a shorter cooldown, it would also limit the potential damage he's able to do in a combo.
